title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" requires the Secretary to develop a plan for purchasing and storing a supply of vaccines for children and adults for a 6-month period. This supply must include all vaccines recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The Secretary is mandated to develop a plan for purchasing and storing a 6-month supply of vaccines for children and adults, as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, including those designated for public health preparedness efforts. The Secretary is authorized to carry out this plan using specific provisions of the Social Security Act and other relevant authorities. The Secretary must submit a plan for purchasing and storing vaccines to relevant Senate and House committees within 6 months of enactment. The plan should discuss the basis for the plan and the prioritization of vaccine purchases. The Secretary must implement the vaccine purchasing plan by September 30, 2008. Manufacturers must give at least 1 year notice before discontinuing vaccine production. The manufacturer must provide at least 1 year notice before discontinuing vaccine production. The Secretary can reduce the notification period if good cause is certified. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines. Ongoing reports must be submitted periodically after the plan is implemented. The Secretary will submit ongoing reports detailing progress and noting impediments to implementing the plan. The first report will include a recommendation on extending the vaccine supply beyond the initial 6-month period. The Secretary will recommend extending the vaccine supply beyond the initial 6-month period and provide a discussion on the considerations that led to the recommendation. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
